Class Score

extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • API_URL

        protected java.lang.String API_URL
        The URL of the API. Ideally this should not be hard-coded, but given the scope of the project, it is more sensible to avoid configurability.

      • CODE

        protected java.lang.String CODE
        Some simple security. Again, ideally this should not be hard-coded.

      • playerName

        protected java.lang.String playerName
        The name of the player that scored. Because a Hall of Fame does not make sense without names.

      • scoreValue

        protected int scoreValue
        The numeric score itself.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Score

        public Score(java.lang.String initPlayerName,
     int initScoreValue)
        Constructor. Sets the playerName and scoreValue properties.
        Parameters:
        initPlayerName - The name of the player.
        initScoreValue - The score itself.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public int send()
        Sends the score to the server. For reference how to do HTTP requests without Apache: http://www.mkyong.com/java/how-to-send-http-request-getpost-in-java/
        Returns:
        The HTTP response code, or -1 if an error was raised.
